intro: Pedilonum pentapterum, commonly known as the five-winged sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. Its unique morphology includes five narrow, wing-like lobes on its leaves, giving it its common name. Pedilonum pentapterum is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appearance.
